item.title: By: Larnelle Garnie
item.dc:creator: Larnelle Garnie
item.description:
There is a mistake in the limit question with ln(1+x)... In the first part you had (ln(1+x)-x+(x^2)/2)/x^2... Then you changed the (x^2)/2 to x^2 and back again... Also.. the answer to (ln(1+x)-x+(x^2)/2)/x^2 is not 1/2 it is 0.
Larnelle GRNLAR008
item.content:encoded:
There is a mistake in the limit question with ln(1+x)… In the first part you had (ln(1+x)-x+(x^2)/2)/x^2… Then you changed the (x^2)/2 to x^2 and back again… Also.. the answer to (ln(1+x)-x+(x^2)/2)/x^2 is not 1/2 it is 0.

Larnelle
GRNLAR008
